message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and their application in image-related tasks such as regressing the scaling factor applied to MNIST digits. Additionally, the paper also discusses the improvement in performance for scale-invariant tasks such as the classification of randomly scaled digits. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques, which makes it likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. 

Furthermore, the paper involves the use of vector fields, which are commonly used in the Neural Engineering (cs.NE) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper also involves the study of the effect of injecting local scale equivariance into CNNs, which makes it likely to belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SD) sub-category.
